main event: A possible satellite sighting was reported in the Pacific Ocean on 15 March 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as small and circular, resembling a bright star., The sighting was tracked through 30 degrees of arc from 192 degrees true to 132 degrees true., The object was reported at an altitude of 35 degrees above the horizon., The weather conditions were noted as having vast visibility., The report involved multiple branches of the military and intelligence agencies, indicating its seriousness.
sighted object: small circular object resembling a bright star
witness description: The reporting aircraft at Pilio heading 193 true.
